name: recapturing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
recapture
to take something into your possession again, especially by force: The army recaptured the town from the rebels.
If something recaptures a previous emotion or style, it makes you experience that emotion again or it repeats that style: The film successfully recaptures the joyful style of the 1940s Hollywood musical.
